instruction: Given a text passage as input consisting of dialogues of negotiations between a seller and a buyer about the sale of an item, the task is to classify the text into one of the labels from the two possible outputs - 'accepted'/'rejected'. Select [accepted] if by the end of the conversation the buyer seems likely to buy the item from the seller. A sale is likely made when the buyer and seller agree upon a common price or when a deal is made between them. Select [rejected] if the buyer did not seem interested in buying the item from the seller at the end of the conversation. This happens when the buyer and seller do not agree on the price or other aspects of the item being sold by the seller.
input:
Buyer: Hey do you still have the car?
Seller: That I do. She is a clean 2004 Honda Odyssey. Bought her brand new off the lot. Many amenities. I'm asking only $3200. 
Buyer: Does it have air conditioning that works?
Seller: Yes, air conditioner works and heating. It has heated seats as well for those long cold trips. Engine was serviced recently and purrs like a kitten. 
Buyer: Would you take 3000.00 cash if I come and get it today?
Seller: That sounds agreeable. I'll take $3000 for it. I'll e-mail you my address here in a little bit. 
Seller: 
Buyer: Great thank you.
Buyer:

Buyer: Nice chatting with you anyway!
